greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The product of the positive integers <= n that are strongly prime to n.
comment: k is strongly prime to n iff k is relatively prime to n and k does not divide n-1.
For 0 we have the empty product, giving 1. - _Daniel Forgues_, Aug 03 2012
Except for 0 and 9, all records appear at prime positions and beginning with the sixth term, are == 0 (mod 100).
Anti-records appear at positions 6, 10, 12, 14, 15, 18, 20, 24, 30, 36, 42, 48, 60, 66, 70, 78, 84, 90, 96, ..., and their values are odd. (End)
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: A181832 := proc(n) local i; mul(i,i=StrongCoprimes(n)) end:
coprimorial := proc(n) local i; mul(i,i=select(k->igcd(k,n)=1,[$1..n])) end:
divisorial  := proc(n) local i; mul(i,i=divisors(n)) end:
mathematica: f[n_] := Times @@ Select[ Range@ n, GCD[#, n] == 1 && Mod[n - 1, #] != 0 &]; Array[f, 27, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 03 2012 *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Nov 17 2010
